metadata.title: CVE-2021-23986 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A malicious extension with the 'search' permission could have installed anew search engine whose favicon referenced a cross-origin URL. The responseto this cross-origin request could have been read by the extension,allowing a same-origin policy bypass by the extension, which should nothave cross-origin permissions. This cross-origin request was made withoutcookies, so the sensitive information disclosed by the violation waslimited to local-network resources or resources that perform IP-basedauthentication. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 87.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
